intro: Diapedium forsterianum, commonly known as the Forster's diapedium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
